posts.name: Elliot Scher
posts.cooked:
So here‚Äôs the problem. Our telescoping tube runs perfectly fine on a NEO and a spark max, but our elevator just won‚Äôt run. The code is exactly the same as the elevator as it is for the telescope, other than that it uses two NEOS, one following the other.

Here is our code: Files ¬∑ Latest ¬∑ Elliot Scher / 2815 Robot 2023 ¬∑ GitLab

One thing to note, our spark maxes for the elevator don‚Äôt turn green/red when trying to run them.

In the rev hardware client, the elevator motors don‚Äôt run either but I‚Äôm not sure whether I am trying to run them incorrectly.

Can anyone help me solve this problem? Thanks!!

link_counts.title: Files ¬∑ Latest ¬∑ Elliot Scher / 2815 Robot 2023 ¬∑ GitLab

posts.name: Mykah
posts.cooked:
Gandagorn:

In the rev hardware client, the elevator motors don‚Äôt run either but I‚Äôm not sure whether I am trying to run them incorrectly.

Make sure the Spark Max(s) aren‚Äôt connected to the RIO when trying to run them from the Hardware Client, and if they were, make sure to power-cycle them before trying to run them in the Hardware Client.

posts.name: Fletch
posts.cooked:
‚ÄúArm‚Äù and ‚Äúelevator‚Äù are quite generic terms and the cause of your issue could very easily depend on specific implementation.  Do you have CAD or pictures of your robot we could reference?

When you say ‚Äúwon‚Äôt run‚Äù, can you clarify what exactly isnt happening? If i understood correctly‚Ä¶ The arm has one motor and elevator has 2, all NEOs connected to SparkMax controllers.  The arm motor works correctly, but the elevator doesn‚Äôt (is it both or just one thats not working?).

posts.name: Elliot Scher
posts.cooked:
That is correct, the arm runs perfectly fine, but both elevator motors do not respond to any of the controls. (Not even an indicator light that shows green or red)

Here is a CAD link: Onshape

posts.name: Elliot Scher
posts.cooked: Does this mean in order to run the motors, we‚Äôd need to remove them from the CAN loop? If this is the case, how can I run both elevator motors at the same time?

posts.name: Jeffrey Dunn
posts.cooked:
In order to run the motors through the rev hardware client the sparks can‚Äôt be connected to the rio. If you wish to run the motors through the drive station they must be connected to the rio.

I would also make sure that your code and spark can ids match as if they don‚Äôt that could be your issue.

Did you mean to set elevator max to 0 in your constants? You have a comment in there that says to change this max from 0, but your constants file has it at 0 still

In your subsystems does telescope work?

Your code shows claw, elevator, and a wrist. Which ones are currently functioning?

posts.name: Elliot Scher
posts.cooked:
yes, on my local repository, these constraints have been removed for testing.

currently, claw and telescope are functioning
It‚Äôs probably more helpful if you push up the code you‚Äôre currently using then so we don‚Äôt give you advice that will waste your time on things you may have already tried.

posts.name: Elliot Scher
posts.cooked: Good idea! Just committed and pushed.

posts.name: Emerson OHara
posts.cooked: Can you go into rev hardware client and see if both motors are set as followers? We have had this issue before where someone had set ‚Äú12‚Äù as a follower of ‚Äú11‚Äù but then went back later and set ‚Äú11‚Äù as a follower of ‚Äú12‚Äù. It seemed as though followers will ignore commands if they can see their leader. Not sure but worth taking a look.

posts.name: Jeff Young
posts.cooked: We had to reflash our followers when this happened to us. No idea why. Controllers would just sit there solid pink and wouldn‚Äôt run the motors.

posts.name: Elliot Scher
posts.cooked: Motor 8 was a leader (it had the ‚Äúrun motor‚Äù button) and 7 was a follower of 8
